t: Deuteronomy 19
When*p the Lord*s thy God hath cut off the nations, whose land the Lord*s thy God giveth thee, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their cities, and in their houses;
Thou*p shalt separate three cities for thee in the midst of thy land, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee to possess it.
Thou*p shalt prepare thee a way, and divide the coasts of thy land, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee to inherit, into three parts, that every slayer may flee thither.
And*p this is the case of the slayer, which shall flee thither, that he may live: Whoso killeth his neighbour ignorantly, whom he hated not in time past;

As*p when a man goeth into the wood with his neighbour to hew wood, and his hand fetcheth a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree, and the head slippeth from the helve, and lighteth upon his neighbour, that he die; he shall flee unto one of those cities, and live:

Lest*p the avenger of the blood pursue the slayer, while his heart is hot, and overtake him, because the way is long, and slay him; whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he hated him not in time past.
Wherefore*p I command thee, saying, Thou shalt separate three cities for thee.
And*p if the Lord*s thy God enlarge thy coast, as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, and give thee all the land which he promised to give unto thy fathers;

If*p thou shalt keep all these commandments to do them, which I command thee this day, to love the Lord*s thy God, and to walk ever in his ways; then shalt thou add three cities more for thee, beside these three:
That*p innocent blood be not shed in thy land, which the Lord*s thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and so blood be upon thee.
But*p if any man hate his neighbour, and lie in wait for him, and rise up against him, and smite him mortally that he die, and fleeth into one of these cities:
Then*p the elders of his city shall send and fetch him thence, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
Thine*p eye shall not pity him, but thou shalt put away the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with thee.
Thou*p shalt not remove thy neighbour's landmark, which they of old time have set in thine inheritance, which thou shalt inherit in the land that the Lord*s thy God giveth thee to possess it.

One*p witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sinneth: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall the matter be established.
If*p a false witness rise up against any man to testify against him that which is wrong;
Then*p both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before the Lord,*s before the priests and the judges, which shall be in those days;
And*p the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness be a false witness, and hath testified falsely against his brother;
Then*p shall ye do unto him, as he had thought to have done unto his brother: so shalt thou put the evil away from among you.
And*p those which remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil among you.
And*p thine eye shall not pity; but life shall go for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
